comments: For n>=2, a(n) is equal to the number of functions f: {1,2,...,n-1}->{1,2,3,4,5} such that Im(f) contains 4 fixed elements. - Aleksandar M. Janjic and _Milan Janjic_, Mar 08 2007
links: Milan Janjic, Enumerative Formulas for Some Functions on Finite Sets
formula: a(n)=24*S(n, 5)=24*A000481(n). - _Emeric Deutsch_, May 02 2004G.f.: -24*x^5/((x-1)*(4*x-1)*(3*x-1)*(2*x-1)*(5*x-1)) [From Maksym Voznyy (voznyy(AT)mail.ru), Jul 26 2009]
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Doug McKenzie mckfam4(AT)aol.com
extensions: G.f. proposed by Maksym Voznyy checked and corrected by R. J. Mathar, Sep 16 2009.
